8D5533B53F1E42CD95AB105E9BD39667.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

3A26338A909E40D0B418DA60D9D9D83A.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

4624B715E59D4BA2910032260FF1637A.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

3A3E0FB48BE442CE830BABAAC995CDEE.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

FDED6D5A7D7842B5AF97FF7831F3239B.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

5DEA0BAC84244B078140E6982B5D1185.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

6416D929472C409281B1BA4D6226B2BB.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety and networking observed during the work placement.

9A694539302C48B3BD7CEC376FA27B19.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

5837410CE87F472CB96CFA662F9FBC4A.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

B403C3C1FB2D495993EE43EF3B545B23.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

5A3B48A1452F4E2B83741A670F2C2885.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

4D2176F8579B4275BDD35DF4B5CE3891.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

57CC1DD67B144268832CB9EF61B0F0FB.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

7F949D9738CC4CEFBC241ADE1A5DCDBD.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

3748F29AF149427A9421206D727B16CE.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

8752458BD1494BB4899F400CF7D1CEE5.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

A49919597AD240E7B1AA0F064F11FDE1.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

86962B8C80314AEFB7DBC7270F69BEAB.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

AF29768AA8AD4A48BD5172B6A418C137.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

841E7DC9D9264CEC8430F4FE63F2AEA6.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

E20AD513188140D48F6F50DDA13E19ED.description: Describe own decision making and problem-solving processes used during competition and reflect on the effectiveness of choices made.

D6815E97F2834012B5AA6B7017294F60.description: Reflect on the benefits of participating in competition in hairstyling.

34DF1C53EE724920BC31CC3857358D0D.description: Implement cutting and styling terms, elements of art, principles of design, variety of tools, techniques and safety practices within a timeline and adhering to given criteria.

F1773D115B7446C49EEFC4154F6C51FE.description: Produce competitive design within a set of regulated guidelines such as safety, sanitation, category theme and use of product and tools.

E665F9BC42944BF4B85B439267F1D9B6.description: Demonstrate competition design within one or more variety outcomes (i.e., trend, fashion, commercial, avant garde, fantasy, cutting, colouring, styling- design elements).

29233B78BDC1490B87B6DB2A16304166.description: Discuss competition categories in hairstyling such as fashion, trends, commercial, avant garde and design.

23F972D5C0374FB4ADE94C91168A002E.description: Apply safe and sanitary practices throughout hairstyling competition.

35778789783C44339B944DE49C0462A1.description: Examine criteria for design and judging used in hairstyling.

3759BCAC83AB48679CAA6540D756C5A4.description: Interpret competition scope document and rules and regulations.

06FBFA3BDB9941FF8E0432BE6417BB9B.description: Identify the qualities (e.g., knowledge, skill, professionalism, communicate effectively and showcases creative impression and ability) and develop the essential skills (e.g., numeracy and communication) of a successful hairstyling competitor.

E6225A5DCDBE48B88CAA2C1AEF01DB46.description: Explain the purpose of competition in hairstyling such as to evaluate competitor on knowledge of basic hairstyling and to develop technical skills and creativity aligned with industry standards.

92D0DFD71D474F9E86C63B5829E37A2D.description: Discuss the levels (e.g., secondary, post-secondary, local, world and professional levels) and types (e.g., virtual, industry and hairstyling association) of competition in hairstyling.

66CD6B27B32047CF823EBEF961A8425B.description: Create competitive hair designs based on an analysis of qualities and criteria required to be successful in competition.

56F8787789664F5B91D517E5BF1BA974.description: Conduct an inquiry into the questions: What are the relevant skills and knowledge needed in barbering service? How are salons using and or implementing barbering services into their successful businesses?

3B2369CF6C5F4F8B88DDC31EBC14AB2C.description: Discuss the importance of safety protocols when using razor and for sharps disposal.

A32BB3C87A7D4C2486B9174482BEE8AA.description: Examine and apply barbering techniques such as clipper over comb, scissor over comb, clipper with guard and razor.

98F09882C2734BEA8A30CFB5D8BD5B6D.description: Identify and apply lotions and sprays used for barbering services.

6E94B3E8A9D442DE8DAB78BA3507DCE7.description: Identify and research any local businesses that specialize in barbering.

F504C724CE334A8BB6B4F7DCC4005255.description: Research and discuss current barbering trends and styles.

548CA01AA51B417ABA8ABD167C29F001.description: Design a hairstyle with temporary hairpieces and attachments.

351C24523B714BCC9C3D34D949F0F5C0.description: Apply and remove semi-permanent hairpieces and extensions.

34F24EB924FF4AE6A8189469884338DF.description: Discuss how to incorporate temporary hairpieces with natural hair.

ED257AB5B74A4FECBA45DE8A97852921.description: Distinguish between choosing to wear hairpieces and hair extensions, or wigs

4CF6FE54AD38402889AB3F3D6678D730.description: Describe how to condition, repair and style hairpieces and extensions.

65167A53BB164087A947FB76A4F8CDE5.description: Discuss methods to remove hair extensions and hairpieces.

66331D2685FA4AABB45E2838BB1A7442.description: Describe the consultation process when selecting hairpieces, extensions and wigs.

D6DCD0ECB10842B9AE3F507C74120F4D.description: Discuss application methods (e.g., clip in wefts or pieces, tape-in, sew-in weaves, fusion and pre-bonded, microlink, microbeads, microloops, wigs, hair wraps, drawstring attachment, hair buns, hair falls, half-wigs, wiglets, hair toppers- crown, top and fringe) for hairpieces and hair extensions.

0D994C743C1042D49C460E960C1F85DA.description: Compare real human hair and synthetic hair.

692A34D8306B4D30AA478097138DE848.description: Define hair extension and describe different types of hairpieces and hair extensions (e.g., temporary, semi-permanent and permanent).

9645772DCEE6475D91D51A8AC1695599.description: Examine application, styling and types of hair extensions.

8C57D14E4FC64F0AA63A11BACFA9B258.description: Discuss knowledge shared by an industry professional (e.g., in person, video, online or social media) regarding hair colouring.

7D3543AA04384946B6C48BE8BBD58445.description: Perform a patch test if needed.

36A2F2D5479E42C7AC4BA74ADB5954DB.description: Describe the effects of demi, semi and temporary hair colour.

02C0A96A19554CBD9231A10457464741.description: Discuss and apply sanitation, disinfection and sterilization practices including use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and appropriate hygiene.

97CAB1585F954E0D98022ECF2B43CF1B.description: Identify tools such as swatch, brushes and bowls.

A88A0F09CE784934A92BB85DEE195FE5.description: Analyze different hair colour application techniques.

A53012F68FB34816A88C959513B8C199.description: Describe how hair structure, strength, elasticity and porosity impact a hair colouring service.

31B825403BC842DD99CDCB1922BF2514.description: Compare different manufacturer’s instructions on colour products and services.

73EA9014C02C4D539A57D71B2CFD8D5F.description: Discuss the types and categories of colour products.

D70488C6BFBB4E6695F02955E2CB050F.description: Explain colour wheel theory as it applies to hair colouring.

1B0A9BB8BD784B62B27F6A7746DF5D35.description: Explore the knowledge, theory and application of hair colour products and services.

FA71D8BE2FB14BE3A90385D86686F561.description: Explain proper home after care steps for maintaining permanent waves.

624B94FB762349E8A56197EA7ED97239.description: Compare the pH and the effects of perm solution(s) and neutralizers.

1B5334735BEA4229BAD46842BB9BAF6D.description: Discuss potential hydrogen (pH) scale in relation to permanent wave services.

38A41FE2152045AB86ED9DE1C983575E.description: Conduct an inquiry into the question, why do we need to know the type of perm solution(s) or reducing agent before starting the physical phase(wrapping)?

F0218AA7DE474E76B585A8F77A13F7A3.description: Perform basic perm wraps on short and long hair mannequins.

EAE5DFE490044B298A33B9537B563AE4.description: Practice basic rod placement including crown to nape.

EE019CB4727F41DAB323D64AC772C818.description: Execute physical phase of perm service (e.g., select tool(s), endpaper technique, base sizes, tool position, wrapping pattern and tension, prevention of fishhooks and distribution of hair on tool).

686AFA5C0F9648F29C88FE8BC763E9EA.description: Discuss and practice perm tool removal process (e.g., remove stabilizer tool, release fastener, unwind tool and remove paper gently).

F3362E3F390E497D866703814900B1C3.description: Demonstrate inserting stabilizer tools such as sticks and picks.

201D059913B74388BA868DE7BB577693.description: Demonstrate winding and securing a perm tool.

D23E15E9EC6643B08C4BB60E0B5FD173.description: Explain endpaper techniques such as bookend, single, double and cushion- wrap.

88EAE2FEF8954170A9412DE93286451B.description: Execute client consultation, pre-service procedures, draping for wet service and chemical restructure service and shampoo procedure.

4B18E95C0C124807AB4AA335A62DDEC8.description: Review hairstyling fundamentals (e.g., porosity and elasticity tests, sections, sub-sections, bases, tool measurement and tool position).

B75A96C2BF604A418C4156BCE200E44C.description: Investigate types of tools used to create chemical texture and tool selection according to length of hair and chosen curl.

84396884275E4EB38488126F135A46DE.description: Discuss wrapping patterns and techniques (e.g., croquinole, spiral, basic, double-halo, single-halo, piggyback, partial, stacked and brick).

451B1C28260645FB87677A8B8F16D173.description: Define and explain permanent waving on hair including applicable trends and styles.

C16C03C0D09B47ACA232722151512CB5.description: Investigate skills and knowledge needed for a permanent wave service.

24EA40F4E2854141B102C98BE32318BE.description: Chemically Restructuring Hair: Introduction to Permanent

F0C98ED4CB444A4AA40653F17A3E4979.description: Research companies and/or individuals that develop chemical restructuring products.

CCC3A9DD99CF4FB0862606D939DA45E3.description: Explore the risk to hairstylists and clients being exposed to chemicals used in services.

1162C08F987141C1BF7F014FD1FE6BC4.description: Perform a strand test for appropriate product selection, patch test for allergic reactions and testing for metallic salt and plant-based dyes.

F8C1B055871245B4AEEA643F82FB7277.description: Discuss the effect of temperature on the rate of chemical reaction in hairstyling.

A4853E3B06064F96B372C30C5776C9AC.description: Contrast elements, compounds and mixtures used in hairstyling.

91B00549A573465992DEE534CD780EF1.description: Categorize different hair care products based on their chemical ingredients or lack of chemical ingredients.

0567D358197D437995D9CD7805C8CDAE.description: Explore chemical reactions of hair products (e.g., bleach, colour and toner) and their effects on hair.

6F1D6A71DB14423FA2AA8ECB86DBDA46.description: Identify chemical ingredients (e.g., hydrogen peroxide and ammonium thioglycolate) in different hair care products and describe the potential outcomes when used on hair.

04C1CCEBE5274B10AB8D16A85062669C.description: Examine the potential hydrogen (pH) scale and describe the effects of acidic and alkaline solutions on hair.

00C1061C9649474FB2F2DDB68D6B9E7B.description: Investigate how chemical restructuring is used in hairstyling.

14917A3EE25E4F47BC192B4696F61E22.description: Explore the impact hair textures (e.g., fine, medium, coarse, kinky and curl pattern) and hair characteristics (e.g., density, elasticity, growth pattern) have on hair cutting techniques.

9D3322A0C5024F16B86B86775AFAD305.description: Perform a client consultation including discussing client desired look.

1C6BB37B48D84424904855E9FFCA8F1A.description: Discuss the relevant questions or steps that would be needed when performing a cut service on a client.

4F1A9C3D94594F60B4D5E298ECDC12B4.description: Apply safety and sanitation practices for hair cutting.

47D5A19F8A1E402E85BEBF647D011EFC.description: Investigate cutting with or without tension.

74B192063D6640049DD9EE06D874241D.description: Demonstrate how to hold and use hair shaping implements.

545DE9037E024303A1D6C832B6CD72C2.description: Analyze hair texture (e.g., fine, medium, coarse, kinky and curl pattern), hair characteristics (e.g., growth patterns, density, weight) and explain the reason and impact of a hair analysis before performing a hair cutting service.

6DE22D251F6446B490E6069AB53D4298.description: Experiment with different haircutting techniques such as blunt or layered.

A65E977946BB417398C45940CA1F46FA.description: Define terms used in haircutting such as blunt or 0° elevation cutting, crosscheck, 45°/90°/135°/180° elevation cutting, guidelines perimeter and interior.

2C5556792D904EF99F13D92CB746DC04.description: Discuss the purpose of tools (e.g., clippers, razor, trimmers) commonly used for haircuts.

2EC6670F69EC48F79E25944CADB6AA65.description: Define hair cutting and determine the purpose of hair cutting.

9174C202150648788E0071207AE952F6.description: Research current hair trends and discuss how the elements of art and principles of design apply to each trend.

4128AD336CEB4B02993B373E889F7557.description: Analyze and apply hair cutting techniques.

58EF01248FB04E4D83F49F4C14135D28.description: Practice appropriate safety and sanitation procedures.

EF6CE65A8A9842D6A3F4D156006E78FD.description: Identify disorders (e.g., hair and scalp) and discuss treatments.

C331B26EBA05445D9DB10272EEA82F8D.description: Analyze client hair and recommend appropriate product and treatments.

AC885DC7A3294795AC7412363BD75F84.description: Research and discuss hair treatment products and trends.

82FDC0C70F9F4265AEE554ACF187DA02.description: Conduct an inquiry into the questions: How has language related to hair been used to racialize beauty? What impact does language have on hairstylist professionalism? How do hairstylists remain open to conversations that honour the perspectives of colleagues and clients?

37407E11CCDD43B1AB6F328732D41DC0.description: Implement the elements of art and principles of design to generate a hairstyle from a visual support (e.g., picture, video, technology and social media).

FD2A93154F4C447EB08AA53185B4CE96.description: Practice inserting bobby pins/hair pins discretely.

E556F5AF40934ED79A291A5ED0042EBD.description: Construct hair direction and design towards a focal point.

80BD67ADCD034D03B26F51EF0A768C25.description: Create a foundation support by backcombing and smoothing using tools and styling aids.

A65309A84792436F816F743F2D317EFE.description: Create up-do hair styles for a variety of hair textures (e.g., fine, medium, coarse, kinky and curl pattern) and hair characteristics (e.g., elasticity, porosity, density).

F80EA6B3889541EE8E0C7191256C8F06.description: Prepare hair for an up do using balanced, controlled and clean sections.

A05092B59DC3441196732FF5D824CA9D.description: Demonstrate roller set variations (e.g., indentation and combination pin curl/finger wave/roller set).

1A0BB7626E6648D0B6634ADF7226CF39.description: Demonstrate long hair roller set and up do comb-out techniques.

540F0E0D42B04D8D96D6DD6A6412E06E.description: Discuss how different hairstyles enhance facial shapes and features.

28E4774862B640A6892A5589CD79029D.description: Analyze how different hairstyles can be created with different hair textures (e.g., fine, medium, coarse, kinky and curl pattern) and hair characteristics (e.g., density, porosity, elasticity).

392DEB5033D84A49B10578B08E1A0B3E.description: Examine how culture, religion and self-identity are expressed through different hairstyles and adornments.

38F7CBADE6EE4F57AFFC04DCA5BEC2C9.description: Research and discuss current hair trends and designs for a variety of hair characteristics.

ADB7358BD5BD46429426E0D2574A03F8.description: Create hairstyles for all hair textures and hair characteristics.

D091963DC24E422B9D48DEE338C48AFD.description: Conduct a client consultation for a hair repair treatment.

549CE4F6DCD3473384BFCD8D4C78FB0E.description: Conduct an inquiry into the questions: What impact does hair texture and hair characteristics have on the analysis of client hair care needs? Why is it important to use industry language (e.g., hair texture and characteristics) when discussing hair?

749FC1DF0F374FBF919E1DFBADC5327F.description: Analyze the theory of massage including purpose of scalp massage, massage movements and the benefits of massage.

0802BC1003E449CC86EAB6FF08487177.description: Execute a scalp treatment including preparation, draping, safety and sanitation procedures.

073ED9D4E6F2484FADF052C22A0BCE21.description: Discuss types of treatments for scalp conditions.

00C58EE102DC46D7835D0D5D05DC94C3.description: Explain the purpose of hair repair products.

25A589E2A5A746EDB5FECCAE3806B718.description: Identify infections (e.g., vegetable, animal, staphylococci) on the scalp.

118D964C25D349D08CB9C4818DFB3939.description: Discuss and practice different types of hair and/or scalp treatments.

4EC9ACD0F68541DD82E670C9CDD35DAD.description: Identify hair and scalp disorders such as psoriasis, alopecia, dandruff and dry or oily scalp by performing a visual inspection with hands or comb.

6CDB667A61D74DE5886874A93DDDAE2A.description: Analyze characteristics of hair and scalp.

F4EB7D24A92946AFB50A9611A522B715.description: Discuss and apply safety practises when using all tools and equipment (e.g., adjust hydraulic chairs and other equipment according to stylist’s ergonomic support, use personal protective equipment (PPE), locate first aid and eye wash stations, discard sharps according to regulations and recognize all hazards).

BE7F2995E1404C15A36941C8C6643339.description: Describe and perform an inspection process (e.g., check for product build- up and determine when a tool must be removed from service) to maintain manual tools, electric tools and equipment (e.g., remove debris from filters in hairdryers, clippers and clothes dryer and discard refuse and product waste according to regulations).

3071C746B3474F0481138E96FE2B8CC8.description: Describe and perform sanitization, sterilization or disinfection of tools and equipment (e.g., spraying disinfectant, wiping and soaking; handling/storing cleaning towels, capes, aprons and smocks).

B0E576FCA125416AB5AB895F87432F6C.description: Discuss the importance of sanitation and safety for each tool and piece of equipment used in hairstyling.

5F9230F71730418EBD72B36CFCA615D7.description: Recognize how proper ergonomic practices are necessary to maintain the health of stylists.

D8BD70F27F88444AB0B25B86213CE133.description: Demonstrate application of hairstyling manual tools, electric tools and equipment.

FACD4A7B2B1649EE9541304D4A8C36F9.description: Describe how manual tools, electric tools and equipment are used in hairstyling.

4B8B127A2F684D18A4185741EE17DFE8.description: Identify single-use and multi-use manual tools, styling tools, cutting tools, electric tools, chemical service tools and equipment used in hairstyling.

946D9DAA124442ABAA02CCBEDC79B5C8.description: Examine maintenance and use of hairstyling equipment.

92DA8BEE4EC2404AA45DA885941B3C6B.description: Design a concept for a salon detailing the services provided.

6781914A849440CBBB052C08A017D6DD.description: Explore how environmentally sustainable products and practices impact salon business.

3ABAE1D1B2114A65B838ACF199F3E2A8.description: Identify techniques used to promote economically sustainable services/treatments.

547BC84ADBDA4E9A9A8326B2B39BE5E4.description: Discuss economic and environmentally sustainable business practices for a salon.

A97A386117764553A6DF125E0517B857.description: Create a salon list of services, determine appropriate pricing for each service and justify the impact on the business operation of the salon.

42CBA8A9A6C54032B4DB342228ECC1A4.description: Critique class created responses to customer complaints including the importance of maintaining professional ethics and positive client relationships.

C5E16BF5766847C5BC97D1F8E399ABCE.description: Create responses to customer complaints and examine their potential impact on salon business.

354141DC49AE47D9811FF28AE5483E27.description: Categorize components (e.g., operation expenses, working environment, profit margin, ethics and client relationships) that are necessary for the business operation of a successful salon.

8842340B100D40E2A2A7F16330DCD04C.description: Analyze characteristics of a successful salon.

698FC40E998D428896EA323A760AAE64.description: Discuss how cultures that have been historically excluded and marginalized are challenging the stereotypical Western ideal of beauty.

5118359DF0C5460CB018052B6B74EF83.description: Discuss how a traditional Western definition of beauty (e.g., hair texture, light-coloured eyes and skin, hetero normativity) excludes and marginalizes expression of identity and culture.

3CD5F5DE6C7445EF83670CD58C55E61C.description: Reflect on personal aesthetic choices (e.g., makeup, hair, nails) and their potential to communicate worldview, culture or self-identity.

85BABF318DDA4913ADE46E77742A5B7B.description: Conduct an inquiry into the question, how does an individual’s expression of human beauty reflect their worldview, culture or self-identity?

285A4748FDC044638B46CE4C1AF81DB8.description: Explore ideals of beauty (e.g., size of earlobes, length of hair, piercings, length of nails and gender expression) across cultures.

13E0DE59AEC840D3985FE7C829BF8732.description: Research and discuss historical and current societal attempts to control (e.g., government regulations/intervention, school dress code) self- expression (e.g., significance of the braid) of beauty.

DD21DEB38C5C4EE9B65DF8AD621D33C6.description: Investigate the impact that worldview and culture have on an individual’s definition of beauty.

396A586299D74E3CA3B17385D6BD8C50.description: Examine hairstyles, skin care, nail techniques and make-up examples within the local community.

BFED55A038994C57946BFD9EC3F36E2C.description: Research how techniques and trends in hairstyling and esthetics reflect worldviews, culture and self-identity.

73195437EB684CCEAFDFA038B0A89D7E.description: Discuss the meaning of worldview, (e.g., attitude and principles) culture (e.g., ethnic background and subculture) and self-identity.

D7F5F44DAD934F1883BFBB3007C71EA1.description: Examine how beauty can be an expression of a person’s worldview, culture and self-identity.

10E712EF3AB84EF587F863B7856BBA55.description: Use colour theory principles and tools to customize hair services to meet individual needs (e.g., warm cool colours, complementary colours, monochromatic analogous and triadic colour schemes).

3D9F89D122544CB78D07949F1C1DB9E3.description: Critique artistic examples of hair (e.g., what are you seeing, why are you drawn to it or why was it a successful artistic expression).

499156D8A4F74EDF95EA93AA61A68CD2.description: Justify why examples of hair creations are appealing based on elements of art and principles of design.

FFD3171648F04DAC80D9D46BD5F85BE3.description: Respond critically, using appropriate vocabulary, to examples in the context of hair creations considering how the elements of art and principles of design are applied.

367C7B4DA0A9449199F8D411D572B04D.description: Discuss how the elements of art and principles of design apply to artistic expression within the context of hair.

A829162EE79841AE9F32EA3966D76940.description: Initiate and develop ideas for artistic expression, within the context of hair, that incorporate the elements of art and principles of design.

9A3EADECD2C44E1DAC4B517C9FBA12EB.description: Contrast a variety of employability skills such as the ability to solve problems, adaptation to difficult situations, working as part of a team and preparedness for work.

42E7500C6ECF4ED4893D5C9B45EE48F4.description: Critique appropriate communication skills for a given scenario or within a classroom role play.

24A1BCBD64674EE58846C80830F4D4E8.description: Discuss useful communications skills such as active listening, asking clarifying questions and awareness of relevant cultural communications styles required during client consultations.

9DCE342D0F6544C1B757377B374BEDD9.description: Discuss the importance of professional conversations with other staff and the impact on the client experience.

BA150EE84BB6453C992930E1740F349E.description: Investigate behaviours (e.g., politeness, accommodating service, modeling hairstyles) and atmosphere (e.g., music, linens, comfort) that clientele find the most approachable and the most conducive to return business.

142C99872F8A40FFB493CB41CB9A34AC.description: Explore the impact of professionalism within hairstyling.

01D9D6B6F4CD4EB7A6C2AACB30D2A367.description: Critique sanitation practices when performing a service (e.g., manicures, pedicure, facial, makeup application, cut and style).

A541381E88B2486391AE2B81A82DD8D4.description: Compare labels on chemicals for proper use and disposal.

237BE082B3EA4D7C8431E20DDBE715DA.description: Recognize the difference between a chemosterilant and a high level disinfectant.

1BEC6FA50CFB4E08A0059AC931E07D01.description: Investigate different processes for disinfecting, sanitizing and sterilizing non-porous items (e.g., glass, metal, electric files, linen).

CEE65B9C18AB458DABFCBE8C9E149732.description: Demonstrate techniques for sanitizing and disinfecting instruments and surfaces.

546A0480510E40CFAA7D63221394EDF3.description: Compare different techniques for sanitizing, disinfecting and sterilizing instruments and surfaces.

75ECE2D5E0D04A07AA0348639CFEC668.description: Discuss the different levels of disinfection (i.e., high, intermediate and low level) and describe situations when each level is appropriate.

5A088F10ADC44A6FB57BFD808908485E.description: Classify single-use implements versus multi-use tools.

50E9751A83CD4235990735ECEC4624CD.description: Classify given scenarios as sanitizing, disinfecting, or sterilizing.

9DE2BA5D563A49EFA6B0B7760B6E7B7D.description: Differentiate the purpose and application of antiseptic versus a disinfectant.

4E8DC82816724B3495981A7A6817D891.description: Describe the three levels of infection control (i.e., sanitation, disinfection and sterilization).

53800112D4214ACD954E9A7CA56685F2.description: Define the terms sanitation, disinfection and sterilization.

8CB03F451A1E4CAB9B821E966D2600A3.description: Justify the importance of proper sanitation, disinfection and sterilization.

726DAF74992E4EDE9F362A71B253B634.description: Identify the effects that wellness components such as posture, exercise, rest, stress management, hygiene and nutrition have on the success of a hairstylist or esthetician.

1759F782CD324111B65B139CF8593093.description: Discuss the importance of ergonomics for the health and well-being of technicians.

0F23B6D77FA743D2A070AFC3C5F04DD6.description: Explain how technician’s choices and behaviours impact safety (e.g., wearing sandals or clothing that exposes skin can cause damage to self or clients).

B17837C406F8443C90120C84241C3874.description: Reflect on the impact that salon cleanliness (e.g., dust, organization) has on safety and business feasibility.

8C1755694BCE40B28483890D261C94D7.description: Brainstorm general safety guidelines for a salon such as managing wires on the floor, extension cords, walkways and handling chemicals.

285344A101574E14B80D303B2F6DC161.description: Discuss general safety practices when using common salon equipment.

6A2846FBAA2A47DDBD297E4B2C04BD57.description: Identify potential hazards in salons, appropriate safety equipment (e.g., personal protective equipment (PPE)) and appropriate safety precautions (e.g., public sanitation, trip hazards).

D0D98583986A42F5BD29662054F7882F.description: Distinguish between provincial and federal health and safety rules and guidelines as applied to hairstyling and esthetics.

B1117EF84A494EE895EDD9E2B1F66F2D.description: Examine general safety requirements within hairstyling and esthetics.
